questions.question: What keyword is used in Java to inherit from a superclass?
options: super
extends
implements
inherit

questions.question: Which of the following is true about class hierarchies in Java?
options: A class can extend multiple classes.
A class can implement multiple interfaces.
Interfaces can contain concrete methods only.
All classes are final by default.
questions.answer: A class can implement multiple interfaces.

questions.question: What is method overriding in Java?
options: Changing the method signature in the subclass.
Providing a specific implementation of a superclass method in the subclass.
Renaming a method in the subclass.
None of the above.
questions.answer: Providing a specific implementation of a superclass method in the subclass.

questions.question: In a class hierarchy, what is the 'is-a' relationship?
options: It denotes that an object of a subclass can be treated as an object of any of its superclasses.
It indicates that a class is composed of other classes.
It signifies that all subclasses must have the same methods as the superclass.
None of the above.
questions.answer: It denotes that an object of a subclass can be treated as an object of any of its superclasses.

questions.question: What does it mean if a class is declared as 'abstract'?
options: It cannot be instantiated, but can be subclassed.
It can contain both abstract and non-abstract methods.
It is a contract for subclasses to provide implementations for abstract methods.
All of the above.
